title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 April 2013 - XWiki
content:
<gihanchanuka> has quit  
00:49 <abusenius> has quit  
00:52 <polx> has quit  
01:54 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
01:55 <sburjan`> has quit

07:26 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:47 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki

11:24 <polx\_> is now known as <polx>  
12:02 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
13:05 <huhongbo> has quit  
13:13 <polx> has quit  
13:21 <sdumitriu> has quit  
13:22 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
13:38 <vmassol> has quit  
13:39 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:51 <abusenius> has quit  
14:09 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:10 <polx> has quit  
14:22 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:21 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
15:40 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
16:49 <polx> has quit  
18:20 <Ben1992> has joined #xwiki  
18:25 <Ben1992> has quit  
18:59 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
19:56 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
20:00 <polx> has quit  
20:10 <diamond> has joined #xwiki  
20:11 <diamond> hi  
20:11 <sdumitriu> Hi  
20:11 <diamond> i am applying for GSoC  
20:12 <diamond> i am planning to code for live notifications for xwiki..  
20:12 <North> has joined #xwiki  
20:13 <North> Hey all ! I am North from India. I have had a look at the ideas page and this live notification intrigued me a lot.  
20:14 <North> I am starting to think if this is some mimic app for Google Drive.  
20:14 <sdumitriu> Hey North  
20:14 <diamond> may be kind of we can borrow few ideas from that i gues  
20:15 <North> any mentor in here so that I can get to know more about the app  
20:16 <North> any help please ?  
20:17 <sdumitriu> The idea is that XWiki has serverside events, and clientside notifications  
20:17 <sdumitriu> But they're not connected  
20:17 <North> yea... I am aware of the problem...  
20:17 <North> and moreover I am starting to code around when two or more authors edit a wiki page collaboratively  
20:17 <sdumitriu> So, you can see some saved event in the Activity page: http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/Main/Activity  
20:18 <webczat> has joined #xwiki  
20:18 <webczat> Hello.  
20:18 <North> hey... yea @ sdumitiru  
20:18 <webczat> If I don't install the xwiki ui package, what choices do I have? is the ui thing unique or can I install all applications contained in it manually?  
20:20 <sdumitriu> For the Java events: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Observation+Module  
20:20 <North> yea... exactly !!!  
20:20 <webczat> like the extension manager, etc?  
20:20 <sdumitriu> For the JavaScript part: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/XWikiNotifications  
20:21 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
20:21 <sdumitriu> So, what's missing is a persistent connection between the server and the client through which the server can send some of the events back to the client  
20:21 <sdumitriu> webczat: Why don't you want to install the UI package?  
20:22 <sdumitriu> webczat: You can indeed install just some of the applications  
20:22 <webczat> hmm maybe it has things I don't want/etc, or I want to exactly customize what I have installed  
20:22 <diamond> some events in the sense?  
20:22 <sdumitriu> webczat: You can manually install the administration application and the extension manager application  
20:23 <sdumitriu> webczat: And then use the EM to install what you need  
20:23 <webczat> and all other things, or there are exceptions?  
20:23 <sdumitriu> diamond: Well, the user doesn't care about changes in other documents, but should be notified by changes in the current event  
20:24 <North> yes... so the idea which is listed is very similar to collaborative editing as in Google drive ?  
20:24 <North> I mean notification stuff... right ?  
20:24 <webczat> I'm not sure how do you download the extension manager if te wiki page does not give the url  
20:25 <sdumitriu> North: Yes  
20:25 <sdumitriu> webczat: Which wiki page?  
20:25 <webczat> extension manager app module description  
20:26 <diamond> @sdumitriu has anyone else applied for this idea..  
20:27 <webczat> I search for an extension manager in the extension list, then I find descriptions but nothing else  
20:27 <sdumitriu> webczat: Hm, indeed the download link is missing  
20:27 <sdumitriu> webczat: Pick your version from http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-extension-ui/  
20:28 <sdumitriu> diamond: So far no, but both you and North are asking about it now  
20:28 <diamond> i have actually worked on live tiles on windows 8 apps...i code around java and c# all the time so i think i can work on this  
20:33 <diamond> I know it is kind of late ..but is there any posiblity for me to apply for this idea? i would love to contribute to this  
20:34 <sdumitriu> Yes, sure  
20:34 <sdumitriu> It's not late yet  
20:34 <North> cool !! @sdumitriu ... well I just saw the idea and found it really interesting. Moreover, I guess this would really be cool stuff to integrate into Wiki :D  
20:34 <sdumitriu> The final decision is at the end of May  
20:35 <diamond> g8 ..:)  
20:37 <North> so I am planning to add a sample proposal to my Git repos even before posting it on GSoC site. Can anyone be of help in reviewing it ?  
20:38 <webczat> How can you make xwiki ext manager display extensions made by xwiki team? possible?  
20:39 <North> ?  
20:40 <sdumitriu> North: Yes, sure  
20:40 <polx> has quit  
20:40 <sdumitriu> webczat: WDYM? Only the ones made by xwiki team?  
20:41 <webczat> yes  
20:41 <sdumitriu> Hm, doesn't look like it's possible  
20:41 <sdumitriu> There's no faceted search  
20:44 <sdumitriu> But you can do an advanced search  
20:45 <sdumitriu> Exension ID: org.xwiki.enterprise:xwiki-enterprise-ui  
20:45 <sdumitriu> Version: your version  
20:45 <sdumitriu> Click search  
20:45 <sdumitriu> And go to the dependencies tav  
20:45 <sdumitriu> tab  
20:45 <diamond> and even the live chat integration "while editing" seems to fit perfectly for xwiki. And I was thinking if there is any step towards it ?  
20:45 <sdumitriu> This will list all the modules shipped by default in XE  
20:45 <sdumitriu> diamond: There are a few prototypes  
20:46 <sdumitriu> But nothing usable yet  
20:46 <cjd> If you want something That Really Works(tm) I'd use a flash irc client and connect it to an irc server or host your own  
20:47 <diamond> can u throw some more light on that so that i can think of more abt it and kind of get integrate into it..  
20:48 <cjd> The limiting factor is that there is no effective way to stream content through the java servlet system, a secondary issue is that live sockets are deceptively hard to make work  
20:50 <sdumitriu> diamond: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/xwiki-platform-chat  
20:51 <webczat> has left #xwiki  
21:01 <diamond> cant we use input output streams ?  
21:03 <diamond> @cjd  
21:04 <diamond> and wat about using filters...@cjd  
21:14 <gihanchanuka> has joined #xwiki  
21:20 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
21:20 <North> has left #xwiki  
21:20 <diamond> has left #xwiki  
21:24 <polx> has quit  
21:37 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
21:37 <polx> has quit
